text: looking to upgrade your deviled egg
recipe I'm going to show you seven
amazing variations that are beautiful
and tasty and they all start with one
base recipes I have eight hard-boiled
eggs and I'm just removing the yolk make
sure you start each slice with a clean
blade and try to keep your white as
intact as possible and while I'm working
on the filling I'm just going to cover
these with a little bit of plastic wrap
and store these in the frigerator for
the filling I'm going to combine all the
good stuff
third cup of mayonnaise tablespoon of
Dijon mustard and a teaspoon of white
wine vinegar which will add a really
nice acidity mash up the yolks using a
fork and this may be where you've seen
most traditional doubled egg recipes end
but we're going to make ours extra silky
smooth this mixture it's nice and
combined now we're going to make it
extra creamy by passing it through this
sieve so I'm pushing through the egg
yolk and the tiny little holes in the
sieve are just making sure that it's all
broken up and smooth and creamy another
great reason to strain your mixture is
that'll be so easy to pass through a
pastry tip I'm going to show you several
different variations with lots of
different tips and it's going to be a
cinch so now our base is ready for all
the different mix-ins the first one I'm
going to make is smoked tomato and
commute on so add two teaspoons tomato
paste and 1 teaspoon of sweet pimento
mix it until it's combined you may have
noticed I haven't added any salt all
these recipes were developed with the
idea of pairing a really rich creamy
yolk and mayonnaise base with a
naturally salty flavor such a beautiful
color let's load our bag so I've already
trimmed a pastry bag and fitted it with
a star tip just use a glass study it and
then it's the less of a balancing act
when you're trying to load it
filling is in my bag and we are ready to
make the first variation this one is
smoky tomato with sweet comment' Oh for
garnish I'm just going to add a little
sprinkle of mint Oh beautiful let's keep
going
why don't we put it on a beautiful tray
each one its own little personality
so next time you're throwing a cocktail
